path: books/Category Theory For Programmers/10. Natural Transformations/2

attr.q: Define at least two different natural transformations between `Reader ()` and the list functor. How many different lists of `()` are there?
attr.a:
```haskell
data Reader a b = Reader (a -> b)
nt1 :: Reader () a -> [a]
nt1 (Reader f) = [f ()]
nt2 :: Reader () a -> [a]
nt2 _ = []
nt3 :: Reader () a -> [a]
nt3 (Reader f) = f () : nt3 (Reader f)
```
